meanings.definition: A tax on salt in France before the Revolution.
meanings.sent1: The gabelle was a tax on salt in old France.
meanings.sent2: The gabelle made salt very expensive for the people.
meanings.sent3: The gabelle on salt was so high, it made the sea salty!
meanings.sent4: The gabelle felt like a heavy burden on the poor.
meanings.sent5: The gabelle on salt was like a heavy rock on their shoulders.

meanings.definition: A tax on commodities in general.
meanings.sent1: The gabelle on goods affected everyone in the market.
meanings.sent2: Traders had to pay the gabelle on all their products.
meanings.sent3: The gabelle on goods seemed like a never-ending bill.
meanings.sent4: The gabelle on commodities weighed down the economy.
meanings.sent5: The gabelle on goods was a heavy load for merchants to bear.

meanings.definition: A tax on land or property.
meanings.sent1: The gabelle on land was a burden for farmers.
meanings.sent2: Owners had to pay the gabelle on their properties annually.
meanings.sent3: The gabelle on land felt like a never-ending bill to the landowners.
meanings.sent4: The gabelle on property squeezed the landowners financially.
meanings.sent5: The gabelle on land was like a heavy weight on their shoulders.
